title: 21 GB/s CSV Parsing Using SIMD on AMD 9950X
summary:
21 GB/s CSV Parsing Using SIMD on AMD 9950X

The blog post discusses the performance improvements of a CSV parsing program called Sep, which uses SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) on the AMD 9950X CPU. The program was developed by the author and has been released on GitHub. The post provides a detailed analysis of the performance improvements achieved by the program, including benchmarks and code examples. The author explains how the program uses SIMD to parse CSV data more efficiently, and how the performance of the program has improved significantly since its initial release. The post also discusses the challenges faced during the development of the program, including issues with mask registers and code generation. Overall, the blog post provides a comprehensive overview of the performance improvements achieved by the program and the challenges faced during its development.
